title: Accessibility statement
heading1: Accessibility statement for ‘Equality and diversity questionnaire’ service
paragraph1: This service will ask a set of questions that will help us check we are treating people fairly and equally. It helps us to meet our commitment to equality (under the Equality Act 2010).
paragraph2: This website is run by HM Courts and Tribunals. We want as many people as possible to be able to use this website, so we have designed it to be accessible. For example, that means you should be able to:
list1-item1: change colours, contrast levels and fonts
list1-item2: zoom in up to 300% without the text spilling off the screen
list1-item3: navigate most of the website using just a keyboard
list1-item4: navigate most of the website using speech recognition software
list1-item5: listen to most of the website using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)
paragraph3: We’ve also made the website text as simple as possible to understand.
paragraph4: AbilityNet has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.
paragraph5: The website is WCAG 2.1 AA compliant and also uses the latest version of the GOV.UK Design System. In addition, we’ve carried out internal and external accessibility testing to ensure that we’re in-line with the latest accessibility standards.
paragraph6: If you need information on this website in a different format like accessible PDF, large print, easy read or braille:
paragraph9: Find out about call charges
paragraph10: We’ll consider your request and get back to you within 10 working days.
heading4: Reporting accessibility problems with this website
paragraph11: We’re always looking to improve the accessibility of this website. If you find any problems that are not listed on this page or think we’re not meeting accessibility requirements, contact:
paragraph12: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the ‘accessibility regulations’). If you’re not happy with how we respond to your complaint, contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS).
paragraph13: We provide a text relay service for people who are deaf, hearing impaired or have a speech impediment.
heading7: Technical information about this website’s accessibility
paragraph14: HMCTS is committed to making its websites accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.
paragraph15: The website is fully compliant with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines version 2.1 AA standard
paragraph16: This statement was prepared on 28<sup>th</sup> May 2020. It was last updated on 28<sup>th</sup> May 2020.
paragraph17: This website was last tested on 15<sup>th</sup> May. The test was carried out by Digital Accessibility Centre Ltd.
paragraph18: We tested all pages of this website against the WCAG 2.1 standard.
heading9: What we’re doing to improve accessibility
paragraph19: This website is continually tested using accessibility software. Any new features which are introduced will also be tested internally or with the Digital Accessibility Centre (DAC).
